The initiatives cover sectors like drinking water, energy, irrigation, and education. PM Modi praised Uttarakhand’s growth, noting its budget rise to over ₹1 lakh crore, and said it could become the “spiritual capital” of the world.

title: Watch: Delhi’s AQI soars beyond 400, triggering health emergency alerts
description: Delhi’s air quality plunged into the ‘severe’ category with AQI readings above 400 across multiple areas including Bawana, RK Puram, and Anand Vihar. The overall AQI stood at 391 on Sunday morning, according to CPCB data. Authorities have implemented Stage II of GRAP and doubled parking fees to combat the worsening pollution.

title: Weight loss vs fat Loss: What is better for blood sugar patients
description: Losing weight is often discussed for health, but fat loss is key for insulin sensitivity.  Focusing on reducing fat, particularly around the abdomen and liver, significantly improves how the body handles blood sugar.  This approach helps restore insulin response and promotes better metabolic health for the long term.  Prioritizing fat reduction over just scale numbers leads to lasting health benefits.

description: Following India's maiden ICC Women's World Cup triumph, all-rounder Deepti Sharma visited the Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain for the Bhasma-Aarti. Sharma, who was Player of the Tournament with 22 wickets, expressed her joy and dedicated her award to her parents. The team had previously visited the temple during the tournament.

Can Muslims join RSS? Mohan Bhagwat answers; explains who is 'not allowed' in Sangh
description: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stated the organization welcomes individuals from all faiths, including Muslims and Christians, provided they identify as "sons of Bharat Mata" and part of Hindu society. He clarified that the RSS focuses on unity and a shared national identity, not caste or religion, and defended its legal standing as a recognized organization.

title: Star anise tea for warmth, digestive relief and respiratory comfort in the cold
description: Star anise evening tea is gaining popularity this cold season. Its warm, liquorice flavour provides comfort and digestive ease. While linked to antiviral research through shikimic acid, experts confirm it is a supportive wellness drink, not a medicine. Simple to prepare, this caffeine-free infusion offers relaxation and aids sleep. Always use authentic Chinese star anise for safety.

description: Uttar Pradesh deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya is confident of a massive majority for the NDA in Bihar. He stated the alliance led by Nitish Kumar will form the government. Maurya dismissed allegations of vote theft by the opposition. He believes the people of Bihar trust Prime Minister Modi and chief minister Nitish Kumar.

description: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar defended his son Parth Pawar against allegations of irregularities in a Pune land deal, calling them "random accusations" ahead of local elections. He stated an inquiry is underway into the sale of government land to a company linked to his son, assuring the truth will emerge soon.

title: How a corporate trainer from Una built two consumer brands and an investment portfolio out of the Tri-City
Vande Mataram row: Congress hits back at PM with 'proof', says CWC followed Tagore's advice
description: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for linking the 1937 Vande Mataram statement to India's partition. Ramesh cited Mahatma Gandhi's collected works and Rabindranath Tagore's advice, stating the CWC's decision to use only the first two stanzas was to avoid religious references and unite against British rule.

title: Pune land scam row: Ajit Pawar defends son Parth Pawar, blames sub-registrar for registering sale deed
'Sacrifice him & keep Dhruv Jurel': Ex-cricketer's brutal India Test XI call
description: Dhruv Jurel's twin centuries for India A against South Africa A have intensified the selection debate for the upcoming Test series. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra believes Jurel deserves a place in the XI, suggesting a middle-order alteration. Ravichandran Ashwin also praised Jurel's form, making it difficult for selectors to overlook him.

description: Aditya Thackeray objected to a drone flying over his Bandra East home, alleging it was "peeping into his home." Police clarified the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) was conducting a survey for a proposed pod taxi service. Thackeray questioned the lack of resident notification and the survey's purpose.

description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor lauded veteran BJP leader LK Advani on his birthday. Tharoor compared Advani's legacy to that of Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi. This drew criticism online, with some accusing him of downplaying Advani's controversial political history. Advani's 1990 Ram Rath Yatra and the subsequent Babri Masjid demolition remain significant events in India's past.

description: The Bharatiya Janata Party has criticised Rahul Gandhi's recent jungle safari in Madhya Pradesh. They labelled his position as 'Leader of Paryatan' or 'Leader of Partying'. The BJP claims this shows Congress's disconnect from electoral realities. They also allege that the party blames the Election Commission of India when facing electoral defeats.

title: Who is Akash Kumar? Meghalaya batter who broke world record for fastest First-Class fifty
description: Meghalaya's Akash Kumar etched his name in cricketing history by smashing the fastest-ever First-Class fifty in just 11 balls during a Ranji Trophy match. The 25-year-old's explosive innings, featuring eight consecutive sixes, shattered the previous world record and stunned onlookers.  Kumar's remarkable feat has propelled him into global cricketing immortality.

He denied allegations, calling it a political conspiracy, and stated he would return after securing bail. Police have issued a lookout notice and initiated proceedings to declare him a proclaimed offender.

description: A 17-year-old boy allegedly shot his schoolmate with his father's licensed pistol in Gurgaon's Sector 48, leaving the victim critically injured. The accused and another minor friend were apprehended shortly after the incident. Police recovered the weapon and ammunition from the rented accommodation, with the motive reportedly stemming from a two-month-old argument.

description: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has assured that Munna Singh Gaud, the father of women’s World Cup–winning cricketer Kranti Gaud, will be reinstated as police constable. Gaud was dismissed in 2012 after an alleged error during election duty. The announcement came during Kranti’s felicitation ceremony in Bhopal, where the CM commended the bowler for bringing glory to the nation and her state.

Bill Gates on foundation’s role; not replacing US aid: ‘That’s not our job’
description: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
description: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle drops ‘Oilers Collection 03’ racing-inspired line
description: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: Marshawn Kneeland’s ‘goodbye’ text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
description: Marshawn Kneeland’s death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Cardiologist warns: 5 everyday drugs that are quietly damaging your heart
description: Common medicines can harm your heart. Cardiologist Dr. Dimitry Yaranov warns about five drug types. Painkillers, chemotherapy drugs, stimulants, some diabetes medicines, and decongestants pose risks. These can raise blood pressure, weaken the heart, or cause irregular rhythms. Awareness and doctor consultation are key to protecting cardiovascular health. Stay informed about your medications.

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Zuckerberg- here's what he said
description: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.
